lines.text: I need some money for lunch, dad. Only 1,000 francs.
Therefore you hope for 500. Therefore you need 300. Here's 100.
Last and simple question. Where is the father?
Ze fazer...
No. The father.
Ze fazer.
No, the tip of the tongue between the teeth. As if you had a lisp. Father.
Fazer.
No.
But I can't, sir. Not everybody has a tongue like yours.
Your parents say you're always lying.
Oh, I lie now and then, I suppose. Sometimes I'd tell them the truth and they still wouldn't believe me, so I prefer to lie.
Every time I cried, my father would imitate me on his fiddle, just to drive me nuts. One day I got fed up and I knocked him out.
I think we should place your child under observation in a special home.
Could it be by the sea, Your Honor?
I'm an unstable psychotic individual with perverted tendencies.
I'm not in the mood.
Too bad, I am.
The best thing is to eat out until the end of the month.
For that, I need a clean shirt.
Doinel, if your paper is first today, it's because I've decided to give the results beginning with the worst.

[to Antoine about another boy in the reformatory]
He escaped a week ago, but they got him. Around here to escape is bad enough, but getting caught is worse.
[first lines]
Doinel, bring me that. Indeed! Go to the corner!
Antoine! He saw me!
Which one's he?
With dark hair. But he should be in school!
You'll get it!
She won't dare tell Dad.
He's a liar!
Like you!
If you raised him right...
Shit! I gave him a name! I feed him!
I'm sick of your complaints! Fed up! If you can't stand him, say so. We'll put him in an orphanage so I can have some peace!
You don't seem surprised.
Why should I be? He's capable of anything.
Sir, it's my mother.
What about her?
She's just died.

[to Rene]
After this I can't live with my parents anymore. I've got to disappear.
My boss drove me home.
Your boss.
I couldn't very well refuse, could I?
I hope you get overtime for that.
I will, at the end of the month.
Those services are usually paid in cash.
Oh, knock it off!
No wonder madame needs to rest on Sunday. By the way, where's my Michelin guide?
How should I know? Ask the boy.
He said he didn't touch it.
He lies through his teeth.
Like someone else I know.
If you raised him better...
I gave him my name, damn it! I put food on the table!
I've had enough of your criticism! Fine! We'll send him to the Jesuits or the army orphans. At least I'd have some peace and quiet!
I have no socks left around these holes.
I saw a police station in a movie. It was cleaner.
I once saw a dirtier one.
And I, a more cheerful one.
If she drops her pen, pick it up, but don't look at her legs. Or else it will be on your record.
Bonjour, Madam!
Little devil!
Your quest of the absolute led you straight to a zero. For you who don't know Balzac, it concerns "A Shady Business".
Women are always taken advantage of at the office, and they don't know what to do about it.
Now, Doinel, go get some water and erase those insanities, or I'll make you lick the wall, my friend.
[last lines]
Your father says he doesn't care what happens to you. You can go to a trade school. You wanted a job? You'll see how much fun a foundry can be!
